data.title: Clear conflict on save
data.body:
This is a problem I see happen occasionally but I only recently found reproduction steps to make it happen consistently.
1. Open a file that is in a Git repo
2. Modify the buffer
3. Save the buffer
4. Modify the buffer
5. Run `cmd-option-z` (Git reset command)
6. Hit cancel from the dialog prompting you to reload
7. Save the buffer
8. Run `cmd-option-z` (Git reset command)
9. Reload dialog shows appears again

I'm assuming the reload dialog in step 9 shouldn't appear since once you save a buffer it should no longer report being in conflict, so the next reset command should occur cleanly.

data.title: Rename ~/.atom/user.coffee to ~/.atom/init.coffee
data.body: Closes #1494

data.title: Select next instance isn’t working correctly
data.body:
Using `cmd + d` to select multiple instances isn’t working correctly for me:

![multi-select-fail](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/296432/2109692/33305c30-8ff5-11e3-99fb-cbc4fdcf42d6.gif)

Note that the first two selections work fine, but when it goes to find the third instance of `h3`, it instead ends up selecting a linebreak or two and an angle bracket `<` immediately prior to the next instance of `h3`.

Also note that repeating the command again after the third (incorrect) selection _skips the next three instances_ of `h3` (the closing tag of the "Payload" heading, and both occurances of the "Headers" heading), and repeats the same incorrect selection on the next `h3` opening tag.

data.title: Switch all packages to MIT license
data.body: For best compatibility with Node community norms.

data.title: Clarify TomDoc usage
data.body:
Currently in this repo there are several styles of documentation formats going on. This stems from the doc format changing over time and not having a clear styleguide for how the API should be documented.
- [x] Add documentation styleguide to `CONTRIBUTING.md`
- [x] Update parameter/return docs in public API to conform to TomDoc

data.title: Remove ConfigObserver
data.body:
Now that you can subscribe to the return value of an `Emitter.on` this class offers very little utility.

Removing it allows us to use the same pattern for subscriptions everywhere and not have this one-off case of a custom mixin for one specific subscription type.
### Before

``` coffee
@observeConfig 'core.themes', -> console.log('themes changed')
```
### After

``` coffee
@subscribe atom.config.observe 'core.themes', -> console.log('themes changed')
```

data.title: Make package loading options consistent and asynchronous
data.body:
- [x] Move all async methods from load to activate
- [x] Remove the need to send `sync` or `immediate` to atom.packages.activatePackage by using promises.

~~Remove unloadPackages~~

Closes #1357

data.title: Clean up comment visibility
data.body:
- [x] Remove empty `# Private:` comments (private is the new default)
- [x] Remove `# Private:` prefix (private is the new default)
- [x] Remove `# Internal:` prefix
- [x] Remove `### Public ###` blocks
- [x] Remove `### Internal ###` blocks
- [x] Remove `### Private ###` blocks

Closes #1512

data.title: Save project state periodically
data.body: The other day I had 4 panes and 2 dozen tabs open representing a particulary dumb / complicated refactor. Then my laptop hard locked. After rebooting and reopening the editor, I was presented with zero panes and zero tabs. This ruined my afternoon. We should probably save project state periodically rather than just on quit, as I only have so many laptops to throw out the window before I run out.

data.title: Build sizes are too big
data.body: Atom's size jumped to over 300mb.

data.title: Spell check does not work
data.body:
Or I'm doing something terribly wrong. I've noticed this for a while now, and figured the key bindings had changed, but today finally broke down and looked them up, and I fear spell check may be a bit off.
## Bug 1: Bad keybindings
### Steps to reproduce
1. Create a markdown file
2. Misspell a word
3. See that it's misspelled (red underline)
4. Press `cmd-:`, which per preferences is spell check
### Expected
- Context menu comes up with spelling suggestions
### Actual
- Nothing
### The Screenshot

![screen shot 2014-02-05 at 10 43 17 am](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/282759/2088535/41831eaa-8e7c-11e3-9894-18ae01f47e5c.png)
## Bug 2: Suggestion menu doesn't correct the word
### Steps to reproduce
1. Repeat steps 1-3 above to set up
2. Press `cmd-shift-P` to open the command menu, type "spell" and select "correct misspelling"
3. Suggestions come up as expected
4. See the correction is highlighted
5. Press enter to select
### Expected
- Word corrected
### Actual
- Line break inserted at cursor
### The Gif

![atom](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/282759/2088514/1762ade8-8e7c-11e3-9dc1-3e31f43d913c.gif)

data.title: Fix grunt build on Windows
data.body: On Windows with node v0.11.x walkdir is ignoring files randomly sometimes, this PR replaced it with `fs.traverseTreeSync`.

data.title: Fix name of argument in docs for clipBufferPosition
Clarify a few small issues from a newbie perspective.
data.body: Just a few changes I think should happen from going through the tutorial and looking to clarify anything that might trip up a first time reader.

data.title: Use squirrel as updater (instead of sparkle)
data.body:
Atom will use squirrel to update instead of sparkle. 

Needs:
- [x] https://github.com/atom/atom-shell/pull/173 to be merged and published
- [x] Atom.io to use the squirrel update API
- [x] Atom to use the Atom.io update endpoint

Closes #1245

data.title: Include type in theme key
data.body: Closes #1505

data.title: Add syntax/ui metadata to theme's package.json
data.body:
Perhaps just reuse the `theme` key with:

``` json
{ "theme": "ui" }
```

``` json
{ "theme": "syntax" }
```

Or add a new `themeType` field.

Something needs to happen since the settings view just checks the theme name for this info which causes issues for themes with neither `ui` or `syntax` in their name.

Any thoughts @probablycorey  ?

data.title: Multiple cursor blinking is out of sync
data.body:
Whenever I  use multiple cursors, the cursors don’t blink in sync with each other. This makes me feel like I’m looking at a person whose eyes don’t blink quite at the same time, and gives me the willies:

![blink-sync-1](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/296432/2066491/91602ad2-8cef-11e3-9087-d7699c6a0333.gif)

![](http://img5.joyreactor.com/pics/comment/gif-blink-more-in-comments-428375.gif)

![](http://img9.joyreactor.com/pics/comment/gif-blink-more-in-comments-428369.gif)

data.title: Both search and cmd-T continue to be intermittently unreliable for me any time file manipulation is
data.body:
Both search and cmd-T continue to be intermittently unreliable for me any time file manipulation is happening outside the editor, especially when files are moved into place via the terminal (a simple file move, create, or git stash pop). Not sure how to be more detailed here without spending a ton of time on it.

I suspect this has to do with the number of files in the project since I see it happen a lot more with github/github.

Project find is still trolling me hard, frequently showing old content and deleted/moved files. It's also still a pain to bounce back and forth without tabs turned on. If there's already a "Project Find Results" "tab" open, why do I have to hit <enter> in the panel as if I'm searching again?
